about_the_game:
• Marriages
Upon deciding to settle down and retire from adventuring the player will now be able to marry and spend the rest of his life with a girl of his choice. If, of course, he manages to capture her heart first.



• Expanded Endings
The DLC increases the number of possible endings while also expanding them with much more detailed epilogues that properly conclude each of the possible story routes.

• New Events
The DLC also brings several new story events including an alternative ending to the Outremer campaign that will see the player go on his own personal crusade against a seemingly invincible enemy and — if successful — become a true Lord of the Desert. Or forever perish in the sands.



Complete feature list
• Added possibility to marry all the girls and get a unique thematic epilogue for each of them.
• Each wedding has its own new art piece.
• Maxing out your relationship with Cecilia or Anna triggers a new event in the French campaign interlude that segways into a new big quest (if you take Cecilia's side in the argument).
• Epilogues for the 'true' endings (that do not come with the death of the player character) have been seriously expanded — they are now much more detailed and provide a more thorough look into the player character's future and properly concluding the whole experience.
• Finding Renauld in the desert now allows you to successfully return back to Europe and get a variety of different endings depending on the choices you have previously made.
• Failing to find Renauld and not marrying Emma at the end of the Outremer chapter now allows you to join a Crusader warband and triggers a new story event — Damanhur campaign — which consists of series of gruelling adventures and culminates with the Crusaders' assault on the city of Damanhur, guarded by a variety of dangerous enemies including 4 new bosses.
• Added a new (11th) ending for the capture of Damanhur with its own unique epilogue.
• Added 9 new achievements.
• Added a new trinket that reduces fatigue gain from heat (can be found in the treasury of the Crusader Fortress).

content_descriptors.notes: General Mature Content (cursing, use of alcohol), Violence (blood, combat)
